div.p: Translation of lines 4-12: (reckoning of interest for Pharmuthi) ‘collect from Arsaces on 1 talent, 120 drachmae; from Ptolemarchus on 1 tal., 120 dr,; from Euphron on 1 tal., 120 dr.; from Ptolemy son of Perdiccas on 2,000 dr., 40 dr.; in sundry ways due through Menecrates, on 3,000 dr., 60 dr.; from Menecrates on 3,000 dr., 60 dr.; from Tryphon, son of Cleitorios on 1,000 dr., 20 dr.; from Chionides on 100 dr., 2 dr. Total interest, 542 drachmae.’
